error.signature: Warning: Can't perform a React state update on an unmounted component
error.regex: Can't perform a React state update on an unmounted component

verdict.summary: Async operation (fetch, setTimeout) completes after the component has unmounted and tries to setState.

dead_ends.why_fails: setState on unmounted component is not an exception; try/catch won't help

dead_ends.action: Ignoring the warning since React 18 removed it
dead_ends.why_fails: React 18 removed the warning but the memory leak from the async operation still exists

workarounds.action: Use an AbortController to cancel async operations on unmount
workarounds.how: useEffect cleanup: const ac = new AbortController(); return () => ac.abort();

workarounds.action: Track mounted state with useRef and check before setState
workarounds.how: const mounted = useRef(true); useEffect(() => () => { mounted.current = false }, []);
